title: 107_hr4893
content: The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2002 includes provisions for the disposal of administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, as outlined in Section 2. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, including various tracts and administrative sites as specified in the Act. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania. Tract 1047, formerly Tracts 551, 551a,b,c, is the original Marienville Ranger District Headquarters on 4.90 acres. Tract 844 is the Marienville ranger residence, with exceptions noted on specific plats. The maps referenced serve as primary descriptions of the lands, with the map taking precedence in case of conflicts with metes and bounds descriptions. The maps are available for public inspection. The maps for National Forest System lands in Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania are available for public inspection in the Office of the Chief of the Forest Service. Consideration for land conveyance includes exchanging land or making cash equalization payments. Any conveyance of land is subject to applicable law. Any conveyance of land under subsection (a) shall be subject to laws and regulations for the National Forest System. The Secretary may give preference to public entities for land use, solicit offers with specified terms, and reject inadequate offers. Revocations may occur upon land conveyance by the Secretary. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary under this section, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. The Secretary may impose additional terms and conditions to protect U.S. interests. The Sheffield Ranger District headquarters in Warren County, Pennsylvania will be conveyed. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map referenced in the conveyance is the primary description of the lands, and in case of conflict, the map shall prevail unless it cannot be located. The map for US Tract 770 shall be available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked. SEC. 4. CONVEYANCE OF MARIENVILLE RANGER RESIDENCE, FOREST COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence, to the Marrienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania. The map serves as the primary description of the lands, and in case of conflict, the map prevails unless it cannot be located. The map is available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary under this section, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary under this section, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. Disposition of funds. The Secretary of Agriculture shall deposit proceeds from sales and exchanges in the Sisk Act Fund for the Allegheny National Forest's facilities and land acquisition. Funds can be used without further appropriation for administrative facilities, site improvements, and land acquisition, subject to the condition of market value for acquired lands. The Secretary of Agriculture can use proceeds from sales and exchanges in the Sisk Act Fund for the Allegheny National Forest for administrative facilities, site improvements, and land acquisition, with the condition that the market value of acquired lands does not exceed 125 percent of the lands disposed of under this Act. SEC. 6. Lands acquired by the Secretary of Agriculture under this Act shall be managed in accordance with the Weeks Act and other relevant laws. The boundaries of the Allegheny National Forest will be adjusted based on land disposal and acquisition. SEC. 7. This Act's conveyance authorities are related to other conveyances. SEC. 7. RELATION TO OTHER CONVEYANCES AUTHORITIES. Lands authorized for disposal under this Act shall not be subject to the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949.
